original: Ecuador withdraws its ambassador from Argentina in protest at the latter sheltering Ecuadorian politician María de los Ángeles Duarte since 2020, refusing to give information of her whereabouts.
simplified: Ecuador is withdrawing its ambassador from Argentina because Argentina has been hiding an Ecuadorian politician named María de los Ángeles Duarte since 2020, and refusing to tell anyone where she is.

original: Ecuador withdraws its ambassador from Argentina in protest at the latter sheltering Ecuadorian politician María de los Ángeles Duarte since 2020, refusing to give information of her whereabouts.
simplified: Ecuador has withdrawn its ambassador from Argentina in protest, as Argentina has refused to provide information about the location of Ecuadorian politician María de los Ángeles Duarte, who has been sheltered there since 2020.

original: The new income tax in India is a significant change on the old 1961 statute, and contains a controversial "angel tax" provision seeking to capture some of the income entering the country from foreign investors funding India's start-ups.
simplified: The new income tax in India is a major update from the old 1961 law. || It includes a debated "angel tax" rule that aims to tax money coming into India from foreign investors supporting Indian start-ups.

original: The new income tax in India is a significant change on the old 1961 statute, and contains a controversial "angel tax" provision seeking to capture some of the income entering the country from foreign investors funding India's start-ups.
simplified: The new income tax law in India is very different from the law that was first introduced in 1961. || It includes a controversial "angel tax" provision, which is aimed at stopping foreign investors from funneling money into India's startups.

original: The new income tax in India is a significant change on the old 1961 statute, and contains a controversial "angel tax" provision seeking to capture some of the income entering the country from foreign investors funding India's start-ups.
simplified: India's new income tax has made a considerable change to the 1961 law and includes a contentious "angel tax" section that targets income flowing into the nation from foreign investors who are financing India's start-ups.

original: In basketball, the Sacramento Kings make the NBA playoffs for the first time since 2006, ending their 17-year playoff drought, the longest in NBA history.
simplified: The Sacramento Kings have made it to the NBA playoffs for the first time in 2006, which means they have ended their 17-year playoff drought. || This is the longest such drought in NBA history.

original: In basketball, the Sacramento Kings make the NBA playoffs for the first time since 2006, ending their 17-year playoff drought, the longest in NBA history.
simplified: The Sacramento Kings, a basketball team, ended their 17-year playoff drought, the longest in the NBA, by qualifying for the playoffs for the first time since 2006.

original: Grocery inflation in the United Kingdom reaches a record high of 17.1%, according to market research group Kantar Worldpanel, amid high levels of inflation, supply chain issues and high energy costs impacting the economy.
simplified: Market research group Kantar Worldpanel reports that grocery inflation in the United Kingdom has hit a new peak of 17.1%. || This is due to high inflation, supply chain problems, and rising energy costs which affect the whole economy.

original: Grocery inflation in the United Kingdom reaches a record high of 17.1%, according to market research group Kantar Worldpanel, amid high levels of inflation, supply chain issues and high energy costs impacting the economy.
simplified: The cost of groceries in the United Kingdom has increased to a record 17.1%, says market research group Kantar Worldpanel. || This is due to high inflation, supply chain problems, and expensive energy affecting the economy.

original: Grocery inflation in the United Kingdom reaches a record high of 17.1%, according to market research group Kantar Worldpanel, amid high levels of inflation, supply chain issues and high energy costs impacting the economy.
simplified: In the UK, the cost of groceries has increased by 17.1%, according to Kantar Worldpanel, which is a market research group. || This is because of high levels of inflation, problems with the supply chain, and the cost of energy affecting the economy.

original: Eleven people die after being crushed in a crowd which gathered to collect food outside a factory in Karachi, Pakistan.
simplified: Eleven individuals were killed when they were squashed in a crowd that had gathered outside a factory in Karachi, Pakistan to get food.

original: Eleven people die after being crushed in a crowd which gathered to collect food outside a factory in Karachi, Pakistan.
simplified: A group of people died in Karachi, Pakistan, after being caught in a crowd that had gathered to get food from a factory.

original: Brazil and China sign an agreement to trade in their own currencies, ceasing the usage of the United States dollar as an intermediary.
simplified: Brazil and China have signed an agreement to trade with each other using their own currencies instead of the United States dollar.

simplified: Brazil and China made an agreement to stop using the US dollar in their trade and instead use their own currencies.

original: Brazil and China sign an agreement to trade in their own currencies, ceasing the usage of the United States dollar as an intermediary.
simplified: Brazil and China sign an agreement to trade in their own currencies instead of using the US dollar as an intermediary.

original: It was the first time the Academy Award Best Picture category featured two sequels (Avatar: The Way of Water and Top Gun: Maverick) as well as the first time two films grossing over $1 billion worldwide were nominated for Best Picture in the same year.
simplified: For the first time, two blockbuster sequels, Avatar: The Way of Water and Top Gun: Maverick, were nominated for Best Picture at the Academy Awards. || This is also the first time two films that made over $1 billion worldwide have been nominated in the same year.

original: The Vatican officially repudiates the discovery doctrine, writing that the 15th-century papal bulls which promoted it were "manipulated for political purposes by competing colonial powers in order to justify immoral acts against indigenous peoples that were carried out, at times, without opposition from ecclesiastical authorities."
simplified: The Vatican disapproves of the discovery doctrine, which 15th-century papal bulls promoted. || These documents were used for political gain by colonial powers, allowing them to commit immoral acts against native people without facing any resistance from religious leaders.

original: The Vatican officially repudiates the discovery doctrine, writing that the 15th-century papal bulls which promoted it were "manipulated for political purposes by competing colonial powers in order to justify immoral acts against indigenous peoples that were carried out, at times, without opposition from ecclesiastical authorities."
simplified: The Vatican denies the discovery doctrine and says that it was used by colonial powers to do bad things to indigenous people. || They say the people in power did these things without being stopped by religious leaders, and the papal bulls that promoted the doctrine were changed to help them do it.

original: The Vatican officially repudiates the discovery doctrine, writing that the 15th-century papal bulls which promoted it were "manipulated for political purposes by competing colonial powers in order to justify immoral acts against indigenous peoples that were carried out, at times, without opposition from ecclesiastical authorities."
simplified: The Vatican formally rejects the discovery doctrine. || They say that the 15th-century religious documents supporting it were misused by colonial powers for political reasons. || This allowed them to carry out wrong actions against native peoples, sometimes without resistance from religious authorities.

original: The Vatican officially repudiates the discovery doctrine, writing that the 15th-century papal bulls which promoted it were "manipulated for political purposes by competing colonial powers in order to justify immoral acts against indigenous peoples that were carried out, at times, without opposition from ecclesiastical authorities."
simplified: The Vatican officially denies the discovery doctrine, claiming that 15th-century papal bulls that supported it were manipulated by colonial powers to justify immoral acts against indigenous people. || These acts were sometimes carried out with the approval of church authorities.

original: The Vatican officially repudiates the discovery doctrine, writing that the 15th-century papal bulls which promoted it were "manipulated for political purposes by competing colonial powers in order to justify immoral acts against indigenous peoples that were carried out, at times, without opposition from ecclesiastical authorities."
simplified: The Vatican has denounced the discovery doctrine, stating that historical papal bulls which supported it were manipulated by colonial powers for political purposes. || These actions were taken against indigenous peoples, sometimes with the approval of the Church, and were morally unjustifiable.

original: Reviewers praised how Keanu Reeves' "Baba Yaga" delivers many impressive action sequences, even if the underlying plot is not something that justifies a runtime nearing 3 hours (with a post-credits scene, no less), and it already opened to over $100 million worldwide.
simplified: Critics complimented Keanu Reeves' "Baba Yaga" for its amazing action scenes. || Although the story is not strong enough to support a nearly 3-hour movie, it has already made over $100 million globally.
